text: one month on we've come back to the
small neighborhood of Pauling in
Tacloban and the houses on this plot of
land bore the full force of the typhoon
the storm surge sweeping in from the sea
and pretty much flattening everything in
its path
now if you look at the pictures from
back then well it was a real mess people
living in truly atrocious conditions
twisted debris rubble absolutely
everywhere and if you look at the
transition well from then and now you
can see that things aren't great but
they're a little bit better quite large
areas of land have been cleared I
imagine people are going to try and
rebuild homes here and just in this pile
on the other side you can see quite a
lot of water this is going to be
recycled it's been collected up again to
try and rebuild people's homes basically
people are just trying to get back to
some sort of normal life you see a lot
of people hammering away patching up
trying to improve their homes and just
get on with things life for me and for
my family is hard of course we were
devastated over where we were destructed
by the typhoon and but one month after
it I could say we're okay already where
we're moving on we're coming up to
Christmas there's a big thing in the
Philippines but a difficult Christmas
yes of course I could say it is
different from the other Christmas that
we had but I know that God will always
be there and we are celebrating God's
birthday so I think it's it's still
going to be a very good Christmas for us
our life will be in full of joy again
after the place
there has been some aid here these blue
tarpaulins vital for keeping out the
rain look like they've come from Japan
but to be honest it looks like a lot of
the rebuilding at least in this
neighborhood has been done by the people
themselves but not just here but across
the whole city and the whole region
people are in for the long haul because
this reconstruction effort is going to
take years
